snippet: Despite the conviction of Sheldon Silver, some good-government groups worry that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo will not be moved to insist on stronger ethics reform laws.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo makes first public comments about conviction of former State Assembly speaker Sheldon Silver, suggesting that he will not take opportunity afforded by trial to pursue more ethics reforms; Cuomo praises package of ethics laws he helped push through earlier in 2015 as strongest state has ever had, although government watchdogs have criticized laws for not going far enough.
lead_paragraph: Despite the conviction of Sheldon Silver, some good-government groups worry that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo will not be moved to insist on stronger ethics reform laws.

headline.main: Cuomo Tempers Hopes for Tougher Ethics Laws
headline.print_headline: Governor Tempers Hopes for Tougher Ethics Laws
